title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
text: Load MACE data viscomp package Network meta-analysis (NMA) model applied using R-package netmeta. MACE dichotomous harmful outcome NMA model constructed using odds ratios () effect size.
code: library(viscomp) data("MACE") library(netmeta) data_NMA <- pairwise(studlab = Study,                        treat = list(treat1, treat2, treat3, treat4),                       n = list(n1, n2, n3, n4),                        event = list(event1, event2, event3, event4),                        data = MACE,                       sm = "OR" )  net <- netmeta(TE = TE,                 seTE = seTE,                 studlab = studlab,                 treat1 = treat1,                treat2 = treat2,                 data = data_NMA,                 small.values = "good",                ref = "UC")

what: Descriptive analysis of components with compdesc
title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
text: compdesc performs descriptive analysis components observed network. provides 3 items output. Item crosstable contains cross-table frequency components. Diagonal elements refer components, -diagonal elements components combinations. cell represents number arms corresponding component (combination) observed. Item heatmat visualizes item crosstable. Diagonal elements refer components parentheses proportion study arms including component provided, -diagonal elements frequency component’s combinations parentheses proportion study arms components study arms component row provided. Also, intensity color proportional relative frequency component combination. Item frequency provides useful descriptive characteristics component’s frequency. addition, reports: number arms component observed (column Frequency) number studies corresponding component included arms (column ) percentage studies corresponding component included arms (column A_percent) number studies corresponding component included least one arm (column B) percentage studies corresponding component included least one arm (column B_percent) number studies corresponding component included arm (column C) percentage studies corresponding component included arm (column C_percent) ratio columns B (column .B). can perform descriptive analysis components :

title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
text: compGraph() meant visualize frequency components’ combinations found network. function resembles network plot nodes represent individual components found network, edges represent combination components found least one treatment arm trials included NMA model. edge’s color represents one unique interventions (components’ combination) found network interventions. Edges’ thickness indicates frequency intervention (combination components) observed network (number arms combination assigned). number frequent combinations can modified argument mostF.  can visualize 10 frequent component combinations :  NMA usually interventions used potentially inactive reference intervention (e.g. placebo, usual care), combined interventions. can exclude interventions argument excl. example, can exclude usual care (UC) component network plot :
code: compGraph(net, mostF = 10, title = "") compGraph(net, mostF = 10, title = "", excl = "UC")

what: Explore the efficacy of the two-by-two components combinations with heatcomp()
title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
text: heatcomp() creates heat plot comparing two--two component combinations reference intervention. Diagonal elements refer components, -diagonal components’ combinations. element summarizes efficacy interventions (obtained NMA model) includes corresponding component combination. frequency components combinations found NMA model printed default (freq = TRUE). Combinations observed NMA model denoted letter “X”. function default uses relative effects median summary measure (median = TRUE). uncertainty around NMA estimates reflected size grey boxes. bigger box, precise estimate. Moreover, magnitude evidence reflected color’s intensity. Dark green red colors indicate large impact outcome. Outcomes nature (beneficial harmful) defined netmeta model (argument small.values). function can also adjusted include z-scores setting argument z_value = TRUE. Z-scores quantify strength statistical evidence. Thus, dark green (red) indicates strong statistical evidence corresponding component (combination components) performs better (worse) reference intervention.  can visualize efficacy components, :  plot see intensive colors observed component E, B, G, combination components B G. Thus, combination seems efficacious according heatcomp(). also see frequency components B, G combination B G equals one, indicating corresponding estimates obtained single intervention. Note also size majority grey boxes large, indicating corresponding NMA estimates precise.
code: heatcomp(net)

previous_headings: Single outcome > Explore the efficacy of the components with specc()
title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
text: specc() works similarly heatcomp() except instead visualizing two--two component combinations, can visualize combinations two components. function default produces violin plots based components’ relative effects (z_value = FALSE).  can visualize distribution component network :  Note plot median estimates components equal diagonal elements heatcomp() function. Moreover, size dots proportional precision NMA estimates. Larger dots denote precise estimates. Note also receive warning message component G included single intervention.
code: specc(net) #> Warning: Violin plot requires at least 2 data point

previous_headings: Single outcome > Explore the efficacy of the components with specc()
title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
text: can visualize distribution component combinations (e.g. , +B, +B+C) :
code: specc(net, combination = c("A", "A + B", "A + B + C"))

previous_headings: Single outcome > Explore the efficacy of the components with specc()
title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
text: Often, interested exploring behavior intervention’s effect number components increased. can :   can also group violins clusters based number components. example, can create violins interventions includes 1 component, 2 components, 1-2 components 2 components, :
code: specc(net, components_number = TRUE) specc(net, components_number = TRUE, groups = c(1, 2, "1-2", "2+"))

what: Explore the efficacy of the components with denscomp()
title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
text: efficacy component (component combination) can explored comparing corresponding densities. denscomp() compares following densities: one density constructed NMA results referring interventions including component (combination) interest, second density refers interventions, including underlying component (combination). function default uses NMA relative effects, can also adjusted use z-scores setting argument z_value = TRUE.  example, interested exploring efficacy component combination +B, can visualize densities NMA relative effect estimates interventions include include components +B, respectively, :   denscomp() can also compare two densities. interested example compare densities interventions include component , components +B, components +B+C, can :
code: denscomp(net, combination = "A+B") denscomp(net, combination = c("A", "A + B", "A + B + C"))

what: Leaving one component out scatter plot with loccos()
title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
text: Exploring whether inclusion exclusion component (combination) positive negative impact efficacy intervention undertaken looking interventions differ specific component (combination). loccos() creates scatter plot x-axis represents NMA relative effect intervention includes underlying component (combination), y-axis represents NMA relative effect intervention consists components just like one x-axis difference include component (combination) interest. point line y = x indicates inclusion/exclusion underlying component affect efficacy interventions. Dots y = x line beneficial outcome, indicate inclusion component hampers treatment effect dots line signify component increases efficacy. opposite holds harmful outcome. function default uses NMA relative effects, can also adjusted use z-scores setting argument z_value = TRUE. can explore impact component , :  Note estimates without component fall y = x line. indicates additivity assumption might hold Component NMA model. additivity implies inclusion/exclusion component impact interventions differ component. expressed visually scatter plot line parallel y = x.
code: loccos(net, combination = "A", histogram = FALSE)

title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
text: watercomp() works similarly loccos() sole difference instead visualizing impact component (combination) scatter plot, impact now visualized waterfall plot. horizontal y = 0 line represents zero impact intervention efficacy extra component added. Bars indicate whether inclusion extra component impact intervention. interpretation direction underlying bars (positive negative) depends nature outcome used (beneficial harmful) obtained automatically netmeta model. function default uses NMA relative effects, can also adjusted use z-scores setting argument z_value = TRUE.  can explore impact component , :
code: watercomp(net, combination = "A")

title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
code: t1 <- c("A", "B", "C", "A+B", "A+C", "B+C", "A") t2 <- c("C", "A", "A+C", "B+C", "A", "B", "B+C")  TE1 <- c(2.12, 3.24, 5.65, -0.60, 0.13, 0.66, 3.28) TE2 <- c(4.69, 2.67, 2.73, -3.41, 1.79, 2.93, 2.51)  seTE1 <- rep(0.1, 7) seTE2 <- rep(0.2, 7)  study <- paste0("study_", 1:7)  data1 <- data.frame("TE" = TE1,                      "seTE" = seTE1,                      "treat1" = t1,                      "treat2" = t2,                      "studlab" = study,                     stringsAsFactors = FALSE)  data2 <- data.frame("TE" = TE2,                      "seTE" = seTE2,                      "treat1" = t1,                      "treat2" = t2,                      "studlab" = study,                     stringsAsFactors = FALSE)  net1 <- netmeta(TE = TE,                  seTE = seTE,                  studlab = studlab,                  treat1 = treat1,                 treat2 = treat2,                  data = data1,                  ref = "A")  net2 <- netmeta::netmeta(TE = TE,                           seTE = seTE,                           studlab = studlab,                           treat1 = treat1,                          treat2 = treat2,                           data = data2,                           ref = "A")

what: Visualize the components’ ranking for multiple outcomes with rankheatplot()
title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
text: rankheatplot() creates rank heat plot ranking interventions can presented across multiple outcomes (Veroniki et al., 2016). Circles corresponds outcomes, rads components. Sectors coloured according ranking relevant components within underlying outcomes. Ranking calculated median (mean) intervention P-scores including component interest particular outcome. coloured scale ranges red (p-score = 0%) green (p-score = 100%). Uncolored sectors, , suggest underlying component included interventions NMA particular outcome.  can visualize p-scores two outcomes, :
code: rankheatplot(list(net1, net2))

previous_headings: Multiple outcomes > Visualize the components’ ranking for multiple outcomes with rankheatplot()
title: An introduction to network meta-analysis using the viscomp package
text: Seitidis, G., Tsokani, S., Christogiannis, C., Kontouli, K.-M., Fyraridis, ., Nikolakopoulos, S., Veroniki, .. Mavridis, D. (2023), Graphical tools visualizing results network meta-analysis multicomponent interventions. Research Synthesis Methods, 1-14. Veroniki, . ., Straus, S. E., Fyraridis, ., & Tricco, . C. (2016). rank-heat plot novel way present results network meta-analysis including multiple outcomes. Journal Clinical Epidemiology, 76, 193–199.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Georgios Seitidis. Author, maintainer. Sofia Tsokani. Author. Christos Christogiannis. Author. Katerina Maria Kontouli. Author. Alexandros Fyraridis. Author. Stavros Nikolakopoulos. Author. Areti Angeliki Veroniki. Author. Dimitris Mavridis. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Seitidis G, Tsokani S, Christogiannis C, Kontouli K, Fyraridis , Nikolakopoulos S, Veroniki , Mavridis D (2023). viscomp: Visualize Multi-Component Interventions Network Meta-Analysis. https://github.com/georgiosseitidis/viscomp, https://georgiosseitidis.github.io/viscomp/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {viscomp: Visualize Multi-Component Interventions in Network Meta-Analysis},   author = {Georgios Seitidis and Sofia Tsokani and Christos Christogiannis and Katerina Maria Kontouli and Alexandros Fyraridis and Stavros Nikolakopoulos and Areti Angeliki Veroniki and Dimitris Mavridis},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/georgiosseitidis/viscomp, https://georgiosseitidis.github.io/viscomp/}, }

title: Visualize Multi-Component Interventions in Network Meta-Analysis
text: goal viscomp provide several visualization tools exploring behavior components network meta-analysis multi-component (complex) interventions: components descriptive analysis heat plot two--two component combinations leaving one component combination scatter plot violin plot specific component combinations’ effects density plot components’ effects waterfall plot interventions’ effects differ certain component combination network graph components rank heat plot components multiple outcomes.

title: Visualize Multi-Component Interventions in Network Meta-Analysis
text: Seitidis, G., Tsokani, S., Christogiannis, C., Kontouli, K.-M., Fyraridis, ., Nikolakopoulos, S., Veroniki, .. Mavridis, D. (2023), Graphical tools visualizing results network meta-analysis multicomponent interventions. Research Synthesis Methods, 1-14.

title: Visualize Multi-Component Interventions in Network Meta-Analysis
text: Installation using R package devtools: Installation using R package remotes:
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("georgiosseitidis/viscomp") install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("georgiosseitidis/viscomp")

title: Visualize Multi-Component Interventions in Network Meta-Analysis
text: illustrate use viscomp vignette:
code: vignette("viscomp", package = "viscomp")

title: Major Adverse Cardiovascular Event — MACE
text: artificial network meta-analysis data compering effectiveness number interventions major adverse cardiovascular events.

title: Major Adverse Cardiovascular Event — MACE
code: MACE

title: Major Adverse Cardiovascular Event — MACE

TRUE legend printed. size_legend size legend.

title: Components Network Graph — compGraph
text: function resembles network plot nodes represent individual components found network edges represent combination components found least one treatment arm trials included network meta-analysis model. edge’s color represents one unique interventions (components’ combination) found network interventions. Edges’ thickness indicates frequency intervention (combination components) observed network (number arms combination assigned). number frequent combinations can modified argument mostF. function default plots five frequent components' combinations found network.

title: Components descriptive analysis — compdesc
text: model object class netmeta. sep single character defines separator interventions components. heatmap logical. TRUE heat matrix component's frequency plotted. percentage logical. TRUE combinations' percentages printed number instead fraction value heatmap. digits single integer value specifies percentages' decimal places heatmap.

title: Components descriptive analysis — compdesc
text: list containing three items crosstable cross-table containing frequency components. cell represents number arms corresponding component combination observed. frequency data.frame contains component's frequency. Columns Component denotes name component Frequency denotes number arms component observed denotes number studies corresponding component included arms A_percent denotes percentage studies corresponding component included arms B denotes number studies corresponding component included least one arm B_percent denotes percentage studies corresponding component included least one arm C denotes number studies corresponding component included arm C_percent denotes percentage studies corresponding component included arm .B denotes ratio columns B. heatmat object class ggplot visualizes item crosstable. Diagonal elements refer components parentheses proportion study   arms including component provided, -diagonal elements frequency component’s combinations parentheses proportion study arms components   study arms component row provided. Also, intensity color proportional relative frequency component combination.

title: Components descriptive analysis — compdesc

title: Components Density Plot — denscomp
code: denscomp(   model,   sep = "+",   combination,   violin = FALSE,   random = TRUE,   z_value = FALSE )

title: Components Density Plot — denscomp
text: model object class netmeta. sep single character defines separator interventions components. combination character vector contains component combinations interest. violin logical. TRUE density visualized via violins instead density plots. random logical. TRUE random-effects NMA model used, instead fixed-effect NMA model. z_value logical. TRUE z-values used, instead intervention effects.

title: Components Density Plot — denscomp
text: object class ggplot.

title: Components Density Plot — denscomp
text: length argument combination 1, function creates two density plots. first produced based interventions include component combination interest (specified argument combination), second interventions include underlying component combination. argument combination includes one elements, number densities equal length argument combination, density based interventions include relative component combination. example, combination = c("+ B", "B + C", "") function produce 3 density plots based interventions includes components "" "B", interventions include components "B" "C" interventions includes component "", respectively. function default uses intervention's relative effects (z_value = FALSE) obtained random-effects network meta-analysis (NMA) model (random = TRUE). can also adjusted use intervention's z-values instead relative effects, setting z_value = TRUE.

title: Components Density Plot — denscomp
text: efficacy components explored via violins plots instead density plots, setting violin = TRUE. Also, case dichotomous outcomes, log-scale used. function can applied network meta-analysis models contain multi-component interventions.

title: Components Density Plot — denscomp
code: data(nmaMACE) denscomp(model = nmaMACE, combination = "C")

title: Components Heat Plot — heatcomp

title: Components Heat Plot — heatcomp
code: heatcomp(   model,   sep = "+",   median = TRUE,   random = TRUE,   z_value = FALSE,   freq = TRUE,   legend_name = NULL )

title: Components Heat Plot — heatcomp
text: model object class netmeta. sep single character defines separator interventions components. median logical. TRUE median used instead mean summary measure. random logical. TRUE random-effects NMA model used instead fixed-effect NMA model. z_value logical. TRUE z-values used instead interventions effects. freq logical. TRUE frequency component combinations printed. legend_name single character specifies title legend.

title: Components Heat Plot — heatcomp
text: object class ggplot.

title: Components Heat Plot — heatcomp
text: Diagonal elements refer components, -diagonal components' combinations. element summarizes default NMA relative effects (z_value = FALSE) interventions includes corresponding component combination. Combinations observed NMA model, denoted letter "X". Frequency component combinations observed NMA printed default (freq = TRUE). summary measure, median used default (median = TRUE). magnitude relative effect reflected color's intensity. Estimates close zero denoted white color, indicates small magnitude corresponding component combination, deep green red colors indicate large magnitude corresponding component combination. Outcomes nature (beneficial harmful) defined netmeta model. function can also adjusted include z-scores setting argument z_value = TRUE. Z-scores quantify strength statistical evidence. Thus, dark green (red) indicates strong statistical evidence corresponding component (combination components) performs better (worse) reference intervention.

title: Components Heat Plot — heatcomp
text: case NMA relative effects used, uncertainty NMA estimates reflected size grey boxes. bigger box, precise estimate. setting median = FALSE, mean used instead median summary measure. function can applied network meta-analysis models contain multi-component interventions.

title: Components Heat Plot — heatcomp
code: data(nmaMACE) heatcomp(model = nmaMACE)

text: model object class netmeta. sep single character defines separator interventions components. combination single character specifies component combination interest. random logical. TRUE random-effects NMA model used instead fixed-effect NMA model. z_value logical. TRUE z-values used instead interventions effects. histogram logical. TRUE histograms added plot. histogram.color single character specifies color histogram. See ggMarginal details.

title: Leaving One Component Combination Out Scatter plot — loccos
text: object class ggplot.

title: Leaving One Component Combination Out Scatter plot — loccos
text: Axis y represents intervention's effect component combination included intervention, axis x represents intervention's effect included. Line \(y = x\) splits plot two parts. beneficial outcome, dots line indicates inclusion component combination balk intervention's efficacy, dots line indicate inclusion component combination increases intervention's efficacy. opposite holds harmful outcomes. component combination interest specified argument combination. example, combination = "", function plots interventions differ component "". combination = NULL, interventions differ one component plotted. function default uses NMA relative effects estimates, can adjusted use z-values setting argument z_value = TRUE. Histograms nodes include include component combination can added scatter plot, setting argument histogram = TRUE.

title: Leaving One Component Combination Out Scatter plot — loccos
text: case dichotomous outcomes, log-scale used axis. Also, function can applied network meta-analysis models contain multi-component interventions.

title: Components Rank Heat Plot — rankheatplot
text: Rank heat plot summarizes components' p-scores multiple outcomes.

title: Components Rank Heat Plot — rankheatplot
code: rankheatplot(   model,   sep = "+",   median = TRUE,   random = TRUE,   outcomeNames = NULL,   cex_components = NULL,   cex_values = NULL,   cex_outcomes = NULL )

title: Components Rank Heat Plot — rankheatplot
text: model list netmeta models. sep single character defines separator interventions components. median logical. TRUE median used summary measure instead mean. random logical vector specifies NMA model outcome. TRUE random-effects NMA model used instead fixed-effects NMA model. outcomeNames character vector specifies names outcomes. cex_components Font size components' names. cex_values Font size p-scores. cex_outcomes Font size outcomes' names.

title: Components Rank Heat Plot — rankheatplot
text: Returns (invisibly) rank heat plot.

title: Components Rank Heat Plot — rankheatplot
text: function creates rank heat plot, number circles depend number outcomes. circle divided total number components, sector colored according corresponding component p-score. Components' p-scores summarized using either median (median = TRUE) mean (median = FALSE) p-scores obtained interventions include corresponding component. sector's colors reflect magnitude components p-scores. Red color indicates low p-score (close zero), green color indicates values close 1. Intervention's p-scores obtained network meta-analysis (NMA) model. default random-effects NMA model used outcome (random = TRUE).

title: Components Rank Heat Plot — rankheatplot
text: function can applied network meta-analysis models contain multi-component interventions.

title: Components Rank Heat Plot — rankheatplot
code: if (FALSE) { # Artificial data set  t1 <- c("A", "B", "C", "A+B", "A+C", "B+C", "A") t2 <- c("C", "A", "A+C", "B+C", "A", "B", "B+C")  TE1 <- c(2.12, 3.24, 5.65, -0.60, 0.13, 0.66, 3.28) TE2 <- c(4.69, 2.67, 2.73, -3.41, 1.79, 2.93, 2.51)  seTE1 <- rep(0.1, 7) seTE2 <- rep(0.2, 7)  study <- paste0("study_", 1:7)  data1 <- data.frame(   "TE" = TE1, "seTE" = seTE1, "treat1" = t1, "treat2" = t2, "studlab" = study,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE )  data2 <- data.frame(   "TE" = TE2, "seTE" = seTE2, "treat1" = t1, "treat2" = t2, "studlab" = study,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE )  # Network meta-analysis models  net1 <- netmeta::netmeta(   TE = TE, seTE = seTE, studlab = studlab, treat1 = treat1,   treat2 = treat2, data = data1, ref = "A" )  net2 <- netmeta::netmeta(   TE = TE, seTE = seTE, studlab = studlab, treat1 = treat1,   treat2 = treat2, data = data2, ref = "A" )  # Rank heat plot  rankheatplot(model = list(net1, net2)) }

what: Specific Component Combination violin plots — specc
title: Specific Component Combination violin plots — specc
text: function based network meta-analysis (NMA) estimates produces violin plots interventions include component combinations interest.

title: Specific Component Combination violin plots — specc
code: specc(   model,   sep = "+",   combination = NULL,   components_number = FALSE,   groups = NULL,   random = TRUE,   z_value = FALSE,   prop_size = TRUE,   fill_violin = "lightblue",   color_violin = "lightblue",   adj_violin = 1,   width_violin = 1,   boxplot = TRUE,   width_boxplot = 0.5,   errorbar_type = 5,   dots = TRUE,   jitter_shape = 16,   jitter_position = 0.01,   values = TRUE )

title: Specific Component Combination violin plots — specc
text: model object class netmeta. sep single character defines separator interventions components. combination character vector specifies component combinations interest. components_number logical. TRUE violins created based number components included interventions. groups character vector contains clusters number components. Elements vector must integer numbers (e.g. 5 "5"), range values (e.g. "3-4" ), "xx+" format (e.g "5+"). random logical. TRUE random-effects NMA model used instead fixed-effect NMA model. z_value logical. TRUE z-values used instead interventions effects. prop_size logical. TRUE case z_value == FALSE, size dots proportional precision estimates. fill_violin fill color violin. See geom_violin details. color_violin color violin. See geom_violin details. adj_violin adjustment violin. See geom_violin details. width_violin width violin. See geom_violin details. boxplot logical. TRUE boxplots plotted. width_boxplot width boxplot. See geom_boxplot details. errorbar_type boxplot's line type. See stat_boxplot details. dots logical. TRUE data points plotted. jitter_shape jitter shape. See geom_jitter details. jitter_position jitter position. See geom_jitter details. values logical. TRUE median value violin printed.

title: Specific Component Combination violin plots — specc
text: object class ggplot.

title: Specific Component Combination violin plots — specc
text: default function creates violin component network (combination = NULL). violin visualizes distribution effect estimates, obtained interventions include corresponding component. Combinations interest specified argument combination. example, combination = c("", "+ B"), two violin plots produced. first one based interventions contain component "", second one, based interventions contain components B. setting argument components_number = TRUE, behavior intervention's effect number components increased explored, producing violins based number components included interventions. number components included intervention ranges 1 3, 3 violins produced total. violins based interventions include one component, two components, three components respectively. number components also categorized groups argument groups. example components_number = TRUE groups = c("1-3", 4, "5+"), 3 violins created. One interventions contain less 3 components, one interventions contain 4 components one contain 5 components. function default uses NMA relative effects, adjusted use intervention's z-scores setting z_value = TRUE. case NMA relative effects, size dots reflects precision estimates. Larger dots indicates precise NMA estimates.

title: Specific Component Combination violin plots — specc
text: case dichotomous outcomes, log-scale used axis y. Also, function can applied network meta-analysis models contain multi-component interventions.

title: Specific Component Combination violin plots — specc
code: data(nmaMACE) specc(model = nmaMACE, combination = c("B", "C", "B + C"))

title: Waterfall plot — watercomp

title: Waterfall plot — watercomp
text: function based intervention's z-values (default choice) obtained network meta-analysis (NMA) model visualizes observed interventions differ one specific component combination, order explore one extra component combination every comparison positive negative impact. Bars \(y = 0\) line, indicates inclusion extra specific component combination impact intervention. direction impact (positive negative), depends outcomes’ nature (beneficial harmful). combination interest defined argument combination. default function visualizes interventions differ one component (combination = NULL). example combination = "+B", function plots interventions differ "+B".

title: Waterfall plot — watercomp
